{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3525289,"name":"Ben Miller","username":"bmiller42","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T20:27:30.547Z","cooked":"

We are having some trouble with our code hanging during testing. I’ve put print statements almost everywhere and cannot for the life of me figure out where the issue is arising. The tests are hanging and not proceeding as expected.

================================= test session starts =================================
platform win32 -- Python 3.13.1, pytest-8.3.4, pluggy-1.5.0
rootdir: C:\Users\bmiller\Documents\FRC_Comp_2025\FRC_Comp_2025
configfile: pyproject.toml
plugins: reraise-2.1.2
collected 4 items

pyfrc_test.py FF

is the output I get from py -3 -m robotpy test and until I kill the terminal it will just sit there.

Running out of ideas and would love some assistance. Our github is linked below if anyone has the time. I just have no idea where to start here.

https://github.com/FRC-Team-9056/FRC_Comp_2025/tree/dev

_2025> py -m robotpy test --islolated -- -s
usage: __main__.py [-h] [--main MAIN_FILE] [-v]
                   [--ignore-plugin-errors]
                   {add-tests,coverage,create-physics,deploy,deploy-info,init,installer,profiler,project,run,sim,sync,test,undeploy} ...
__main__.py: error: unrecognized arguments: --islolated

Version 2025.2.1.3
